content.heroIntro:
Torrevieja is the vibrant heart of Costa Blanca South, offering an authentic Spanish coastal lifestyle combined with excellent value property and one of Europe's largest international communities. With over 80,000 residents representing 100+ nationalities, this is a town that truly embraces diversity while maintaining its Spanish character.

The town is famous for its two stunning salt lakes—the pink Laguna Rosa and the green Laguna de Torrevieja—which create a unique microclimate with exceptionally clean air. The World Health Organization has recognized Torrevieja as having one of the healthiest climates in Europe, with over 300 sunny days annually and mild winters averaging 16-18°C.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in Torrevieja offers the best of both worlds: authentic Spanish culture with the convenience of a large international community. The famous Friday market is one of Spain's largest, stretching over 2 km with hundreds of stalls. The seafront promenade buzzes with activity year-round, lined with restaurants, cafés, and traditional tapas bars.

The town maintains a genuine Spanish atmosphere despite its international population. You'll find traditional fiestas throughout the year, including the famous Habaneras choral music festival in August.

Large international community with English widely spoken
Famous pink salt lake (Laguna Rosa) and nature reserves
Excellent value property compared to Costa Blanca North

amenitiesSection.beaches: Torrevieja boasts Blue Flag beaches along its coastline. Playa del Cura is the main central beach with a wide promenade perfect for evening strolls. Playa de Los Locos offers calm, shallow waters ideal for families. For something more natural, La Mata beach stretches for kilometers with protected dunes and fewer crowds.
amenitiesSection.dining: The seafront is lined with restaurants serving fresh seafood—try the local caldero (fish stew) or arroz a banda. The town center has traditional Spanish tapas bars alongside international options. The port area offers waterfront dining with views of the fishing boats bringing in the daily catch.
amenitiesSection.shopping: The Friday market is legendary—one of Spain's largest with everything from fresh produce to clothing. Habaneras Shopping Center in town offers major Spanish and international brands, a supermarket, and cinema. For larger shopping, Zenia Boulevard (15 min) is one of Europe's largest open-air malls.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja is a modern university hospital right in town, offering comprehensive services with many English-speaking staff. Numerous private clinics, dentists, and 24-hour pharmacies serve the community. The large expat population means finding English-speaking healthcare is never difficult.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport is 45 km away (35 minutes via AP-7 motorway). Murcia-Corvera Airport is 40 km (30 minutes). Regular buses connect to Alicante, Murcia, and surrounding towns. Having a car is recommended but not essential for town living. The planned Mediterranean Corridor rail link will eventually connect Torrevieja.

content.propertyMarketSection:
Torrevieja offers exceptional value in the Costa Blanca property market. New build apartments start from around €180,000-220,000 for 2-bedroom units, while villas range from €350,000-650,000. This represents significantly better value than Costa Blanca North, attracting buyers seeking modern properties without premium pricing.

The market has seen strong growth in recent years, driven by international demand and limited new supply. New developments typically sell out quickly, especially those close to amenities or with sea views.

Investment potential is strong—the large tourism industry and international resident population create year-round rental demand. Properties with pools and modern amenities achieve strong rental returns, particularly during the extended summer season.

faqs.question: Is Torrevieja a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja offers excellent value for money with modern new builds at prices significantly lower than Costa Blanca North. The large international community, full hospital, good transport links, and strong rental market make it attractive for both permanent residents and investors. The WHO-recognized healthy climate is an added bonus.

faqs.question: How far is Torrevieja from Alicante Airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is approximately 45 km from Torrevieja, which takes around 35 minutes via the AP-7 motorway. Murcia-Corvera Airport is slightly closer at 40 km (30 minutes), offering additional flight options.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja offers a lower cost of living than many other Costa Blanca towns. Groceries, dining out, and services are reasonably priced. Expect monthly living costs of €1,200-1,800 for a couple including rent/mortgage, utilities, food, and entertainment—significantly less than northern Europe.

faqs.question: Is English widely spoken in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Yes, English is widely spoken in Torrevieja due to the large British and international community. Most shops, restaurants, healthcare providers, and services cater to English speakers. However, learning some Spanish will enrich your experience and is appreciated by locals.

faqs.question: What are property prices like in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: New build apartments in Torrevieja start from around €180,000 for 2-bedroom units. Townhouses range from €220,000-350,000, while villas start around €350,000 and can reach €650,000+ for luxury properties. Resale properties offer even more affordable options.

faqs.question: What makes the Torrevieja climate special?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja's climate has been recognized by the World Health Organization as one of the healthiest in Europe. The salt lakes create a unique microclimate with exceptionally clean, mineral-rich air. The area enjoys over 300 sunny days per year with mild winters averaging 16-18°C.

faqs.question: Are there good healthcare facilities in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja has excellent healthcare including the modern Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja with English-speaking staff. There are numerous private clinics, dental practices, and 24-hour pharmacies. The large expat community means healthcare services are well-adapted to international patients.

faqs.question: What is the rental market like in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja has a strong rental market driven by tourism and the international community. Holiday rentals are popular year-round, with peak demand in summer. Long-term rentals are also in demand from expats and retirees. Well-located properties with pools and modern amenities achieve the best returns.

faqs.question: What are the best areas to buy in Torrevieja?
faqs.answer: Popular areas include the town center for convenience, Playa del Cura for beach proximity, La Mata for a quieter atmosphere near natural beaches, and urbanizations like Aguas Nuevas and Los Balcones for modern developments. Each area offers different lifestyles and price points.

faqs.question: Is Torrevieja suitable for families?
faqs.answer: Yes, Torrevieja is very family-friendly with safe beaches, good schools (including international options nearby), plenty of parks and recreational facilities, and a welcoming community. The affordable cost of living and good healthcare make it practical for families too.
